comment: Great Professor. He uses his own PowerPoint slides that are pretty good, so no textbook needed. Smart guy in general.

Chang is a real pleasure to be taught by. The material is hard to grasp just by reading a book and he always goes over examples while he is lecturing and often engages the class by asking them questions. He has been teaching for many years and his labs are very fun. Very little homework is assigned and offers at least 2 practice tests per exam.

Professor Chang will constantly remind you that he's in charge of logic design and WILL fail you which makes it all the more disappointing that he's a terrible professor. Just walks out on his lab section and punts it all on the TA because he has better things to do? Canceled the last class before a major exam early rather than review. Total jerk

This professor is a fair grader, and teaches extremely well. I had no prior knowledge about digital logic, and I got a 61 on the first test, but finished the class with an A without a curve after studying HARD for test 2 and the final. It is up to you to earn the grade that you want. Do NOT make the mistake of relying on a curve, In any class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Funny but not the best instructor. Tests are ambiguous. These tests are really hard. So do not take him unless you have some kind of understanding of Digital Logic Design before you take his class
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Yusun Chang is an excellent professor. For any EE majors at KSU, he is one of the best to teach Digital Logic Design. He is a hard professor, but it is rewarding. If you skip class, you will basically fail by missing out on important information. It all builds on each other so DONT skip. If you are an A student, he offers research positions at GT.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very smart and kind professor with great instruction about class materials. He does not give enough materials about the class so do not miss the class. The tests are extremely hard but he gave curves. Only three tests with tought grading but finals are quite similar to the previous test.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Only 2 tests and final labs. Doesn't use anything like a projector or computer to help us learn faster... The material in class is very easy compared to what he expects on the tests.. He never tell students where to study from , very very ambiguous on instructions in class an tests overall. wouldn't take it again. No d2l , no book.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Tests? Not many--Tests are tough

comment: Take this class If you wish to learn more about networking, no HW no lab, only two exam (mid term and final), mid term is easy.

Digital logic is to many, the class that will determine if you're cut out to do EE. It's not an easy class by any means, but the professor teaches it very well. If you go see him for help he will clear up any confusion you have about the material.

Chang is a fun professor.He interacts with students and has a sense of humor.His style is what I'd expect from a professor at a large university like GA Tech.He doesn't just give passing grades out,he makes you earn them and that's what I like about him. If you don't understand,he'll explain it to you and he actually cares if you put forth effort.

He submitted my final grade online as a B and later e-mailed me that it would have to be a C. Overall,he curved a B to 74 since the test averages were 50%. He gave us a pop exam, but we could correct mistakes for credit though. The final exam was super easy. The lab was tough because the TA gave no sort of rundown or anything. Prof was late a lot.
Brilliant man, great teacher. Would love to have him again.

No one is going to tell you this class is a walk in the park, in fact it's quite the opposite. However I really do like Professor Chang. He has a sense of humour and going to his office hours will make worlds of difference. I recommend if you wish to learn something before you graduate. <3

Excellent, but notoriously difficutl class. The subject was quite difficult, and the class average exam scores were scaringly low; not to worry as he curves quite a bit. I'd take his class again as he's fair and respects students.
Same exact thoughts as the previous comment. Total academic no world experience. Definitely poor teaching methods and gets frustrated when people ask too many questions...

This was his first semester. Nice guy but unexperienced both in teaching and the material. Typical academic. He didn't seem to have a background in electric machines but was smart enough to be able to learn the material well enough to teach the class to us.
